item.title: File locking in Linux
item.description: Table of contents Introduction Advisory locking Common features Differing features File descriptors and i-nodes BSD locks (flock) POSIX record locks (fcntl) lockf function Open file description locks (fcntl) Emulating Open file description locks Command line tools Mandatory locking Introduction File locking is a mutual-exclusion mechanism for files. Linux supports two major kinds of file locks: advisory locks mandatory locks Below we discuss all lock types available in POSIX and Linux and provide usage examples.
